unnormalised: **Quality Control Crucial for "Make in India" Success**
normalised: quality control crucial for "make in india" success

unnormalised: New Delhi: As India pushes for self-reliance through initiatives like "Make in India," experts emphasize that stringent quality control within manufacturing and supply chains is paramount. A recent seminar at IIT-Kanpur highlighted the critical role QC plays in ensuring product reliability and competitiveness in global markets.
normalised: new delhi: as india pushes for self reliance through initiatives like "make in india," experts emphasize that stringent quality control within manufacturing and supply chains is paramount. a recent seminar at I I T kanpur highlighted the critical role Q C plays in ensuring product reliability and competitiveness in global markets.

unnormalised: "We cannot compromise on quality if we want to be a global manufacturing hub," stated Dr. Sharma, a QC specialist from Mahindra & Mahindra, during the event held on 26/01/2024. The discussion centered on adopting best practices like Six Sigma and Total Quality Management (TQM) to minimize defects and optimize production processes.

unnormalised: Furthermore, the Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) is actively working on strengthening its certification processes. A BIS official confirmed that surprise inspections will be conducted more frequently, including unannounced audits at 14:30 hrs, starting next month. The goal is to ensure manufacturers adhere to the prescribed standards. This drive also aims to reduce the number of counterfeit products in the market by Diwali (10/11/2024). Neglecting QC can lead to hefty losses, damage brand reputation, and even pose safety risks to consumers.
